title: Has anyone made high gloss units?

posts.content:
I'd quite like to put some high gloss units in my van, I've seen a conversion using B&Q units which looks fab but they're not quite the right size for me. Has anyone had any experience of making them? I've see the high gloss formica but is that easy or hard to work with? Is there a better product to use?

Thanks
Florence

mine are wooden units sprayed with car paint and lacquered, built by kustom interiors and then sent to be professionally painted at a spray shop, So I didn't build them


I did just build some high gloss cupboards for the house using MDF and car paint and they came up pretty good but took a while and I trashed my garage spraying in there
used MDF sealer, followed by 2 coats of primer, 2 coats of paint. then 2 coats of lacquer to get a decent gloss finish.
Probably best to make em then take them to be sprayed.

Ewan they look brilliant, and even better you can choose exactly the right colour. How much did it cost to get them sprayed if you don't mind me asking? And what's the best wood to use? I think you've solved all mu problems there, Thanks

I think the van units are made from solid wood (I have no idea what type) but If I was going to make them myself I wouldn't have a problem using MDF........But I am no carpenter. I am sure that someone on here will tell you if that is a bad idea!

Use MR(moisture resistant) MDF. It's better quality make up . Denser and machines to better finish as well as being unaffected by moisture. Avoid the cheap MDF from the likes of B&Q etc it's not much better than cardboard!
We make bedroom, bathroom and all sorts of cabinet doors and get them finished by a local company. The 'super high gloss' is the most expensive finish-he charges Â£90 per sq mt, but it is a fantastic mirror finish

Thanks both! The super high gloss sounds just the job, I don't mind paying a bit more for a quality finish. Splipete where are you based? I'd like to go for a recommended company if I can. Too many cowboys out there, I had a first class cowboy do my kitchen so I don't want to make that mistake again!

Florence,

I am South of Bristol so probably not much help to you in the south east. If it were just the doors or simple panels you needed, I could sort them out if you had dimesions and colours etc, but to make fitted units from a distance without full details is not quite so simple.
